challenge.title: Declare String Variables
challenge.description:
Previously you used the following code to declare a variable:

var myName;

But you can also declare a string variable like this:

var myName = "your name";

"your name" is called a string literal. A string literal, or string, is a series of zero or more characters enclosed in single or double quotes.
challenge.instructions: Create two new string variables: myFirstName and myLastName and assign them the values of your first and last name, respectively.

tests.text: myFirstName should be a string with at least one character in it.
myLastName should be a string with at least one character in it.

challengeFiles.name: script
challengeFiles.tail: if(typeof myFirstName !== "undefined" && typeof myLastName !== "undefined"){(function(){return myFirstName + ', ' + myLastName;})();}

challengeFiles.name: script
